snippet: Some of the nation's largest exchanges face stricter oversight under a plan approved on Thursday, a move that came even as federal regulators agreed to delay bolder plans to scrutinize the $700 trillion derivatives market.
abstract: Some of the nation's largest exchanges face stricter oversight under a plan approved on Thursday, a move that came even as federal regulators agreed to delay bolder plans to scrutinize the $700 trillion derivatives market.

headline.main: Regulator Approves New Exchange Rules, but Delays Others

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
